Many shamans possess abilities similar to lycanthropy: they can change form to that of a large hyena at will, allowing them to hunt with the pack and travel at speed. These abilities are the result of grisly rituals centered around the desecration of graves, and consumption of disinterred corpses, preferably those of notable virtue in life.
There are three distinct species of gnoll; the powerful and aggressive {@race plains gnoll|RotH}, the cowardly and opportunistic {@race gutter gnoll|RotH}, and the cunning and elusive rock gnoll.

entries.name: Rock Gnolls
entries: Small and stocky (as far as gnolls go), rock gnolls average at around the same size as a well-muscled human. Of all gnolls, they have the most impressive manes, which can deceive observers into thinking them larger than they truly are. While rock gnolls are certainly the least threatening variety on their own merits, the creeping influence of the caves below means they are also the most likely to exhibit vampirism, demonic possession, or otherworldly corruption, so seasoned travelers know not to take their smaller stature at face value.

entries.name: Culture
entries: As the smallest species, rock gnolls rely on stealth and cunning more than brute strength. They rarely form groups of more than twenty, allowing them to conceal their movements more easily. They inhabit caves during the day and foray out only under the cover of night. When left to their own devices, rock gnolls congregate in loose bands, ofen consisting of a single extended family. Infghting is rarer than in other gnoll clans, so rock gnolls tend to live longer - sometimes up to forty years. Skirting the shallows of the deep below, however, ofen brings them into contact with far more powerful entities, and it is not uncommon to fnd large number of rock gnolls under the thrall of a subterranean warlord.

Rock gnolls are the most likely to take victims alive for two reasons. Firstly, their environment is the least bountiful of all the gnolls, so many clans keep a "larder" of fresh meat when times are good to prepare for leaner times ahead. Secondly, their ties to the underground races make them an ideal link to the surface, and the demand for slaves below is constant. Rock gnolls are generally willing to trade their stock for supplies (assuming the interested party proves sufciently strong that the gnolls could not simply take them by force), and are particularly amenable to offers of alcohol, which they have neither the ingredients nor the skills to make themselves.

entries.name: Environment
entries: As the name suggests, rock gnolls are ofen encountered in mountainous areas, canyons and caves, anywhere where their greyish hides help them blend in, and there are plenty of crags and overhangs to provide cover from searching eyes.

Industrious by gnoll standards, rock gnolls construct crude dwellings from piled stone, and some clans are able to scavenge enough wood for roofs or cages as temporary housing for slaves before they are traded on. The readiest source of wood for most clans comes in the form of passing caravans, so it is not uncommon for a merchant or caravan guard to fnd themselves imprisoned in the remains of their own wagon before being sold off to some denizen of the deep caves.

entries.name: Roleplaying Rock Gnolls
entries: Rock gnolls are the most likely to cooperate with other races, as trade makes up a good part of their means of survival. Common and Undercommon are fairly likely to be spoken, but some clans might also pick up scraps of Dwarven and Elvish dependent on who lives in the area to trade. Rock gnolls are also the least likely to fght to the death, possessing neither the brutish savagery of {@race Plains Gnoll|RotH|plains gnolls} or the feral nature of {@race Gutter Gnoll|RotH|Gutter gnolls}. Given their usual interactions, a surrendering rock gnoll expects to be taken into slavery, a fate it may later escape if it can utilize its cunning.

entries.name: Language and Common Names
entries: Plains gnolls attack recklessly and wildly, seeking to spill as much blood as possible. Like many predators, they will work as a pack to split up their enemies and separate the weakest to surround and overwhelm. If the fight goes against them, the gnolls will signal a retreat but, unless their losses are severe, they will continue to pursue their quarry at a distance, trusting that their innate toughness will allow them to recover from their injuries before the weakened target can.
{@i Gnoll Names:} Aaonha, Drrell, Gorgg, Gruut, Haau'm, Meekau, Ooa'ri, Otuba, Rourt, Rrow'e, Skaa'bau, Yikitka, Zau'ki

entries.name: Combat Tactics
entries: Rock gnolls plan their attacks more thoroughly than other types, hanging back until they can utilize the environment to their best advantage. They may even make use of crude traps, or set up hazards to drive their quarry into a more advantageous ambush site. Rock gnolls prefer to take live captives where possible, but won't hesitate to kill any who seem like they may be more trouble than they're worth. Tey also have no compunctions about selling damaged goods, so are happy to seriously wound their quarry before returning home.

entries.name: Iwa Eeni
entries: Amongst gnolls, demonic possession is normally viewed as a favor from their gods. Afer all, a demon will make its host behave more aggressively, enhancing its animal savagery and, from a gnoll's perspective, what could be better?

Any member of the Iwa Eeni ('Rock Ghosts') could be possessed by the demon known as Bowda at any time, although it seems to favor the clan's shaman, Graon. The demon's presence weakens and tires its host over time, however, so Bowda flits between the shaman and other clan members to keep its collection of hosts in the best possible condition. Bowda rewards the gnolls' service with enhanced senses, and some basic divination, gifing them extra insight into the goings on in the area to more accurately locate passing traders and caravans, allowing them to plan the most effective attacks.

As with all things, however, Bowda does not do this out of the goodness of its heart (not that it has one), but is manipulating the Iwa Eeni towards its own purpose. The slaves caught by the gnolls are primarily traded with a group representing the Brabus family, a powerful family of dark elves who dwell in the unfathomable underground depths. In their excavations and expansions, the dark elves are, unknowingly, nearing a subterranean altar (of unknown but ancient origin) dedicated to Bowda, and a constant supply of fresh slaves ensures that, sooner or later, they will stumble across it. Should the dark elves, with their predilection for demon worship, discover and make the proper sacrifces at the altar, Bowda's full power shall be unleashed on the world
Unaware that they are pieces in a much larger game, the Iwa Eeni simply view Bowda as a blessing, and a sign that theirs is the pinnacle of the gnoll way of life.

entries.name: Age
entries: Gnolls mature rapidly, reaching adulthood by three or four and growing old at 40.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Outside their own clan, gnolls care little for order, ending towards a chaotic disposition. Beyond this, they imprint strongly on those that raised them and usually reflect their values.

entries.name: Size
entries: Gnolls range from six to eight feet tall, and are heavily muscled, especially around the neck and shoulders, and you weigh between 200 and 250 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: As part of your bestial heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your jaws are a natural weapon, and you can bite as an unarmed strike, dealing 1d4 + your Strength modifier piercing damage on a hit, instead of the normal damage. This damage increases to 1d6 at 8th level and 1d8 at 14th level.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Gnoll and one other language of your choice. Gnoll has no formalized written component of its own, and is nearly impossible to transcribe (though attempts have been made), consisting mostly of guttural grunts and piercing howls.

entries.name: Lookout
entries: You gain profciency in the Perception skill.

entries.name: Cave Dweller
entries: While in rocky terrain, you are considered profcient in the Stealth skill.

table.name: Bugbear Trinkets
intro: The following items might be carried by a bugbear:
rows: A bone figurine of a totem animal (cat, boar, deer, wolf etc.), worn smooth from handling
A stone arrowhead carved with notches
A pristine owl feather
A small bowl of pasty ochre paint
A short string of beads; mostly wood, but every third is polished bone inscribed with a rune
A shrunken head with gemstones stitched in the eye sockets
A cured gnoll stomach containing an acidic mash
A wreath of feathers and dried herbs bound together with tightly woven leather strips
A cracked clay bowl stained with dried blood
A troll's claw, which is still slowly growing

table.name: Bugbear Lair Details
intro: An area controlled by bugbears might display the following:
rows: A cluster of smoke-dried heads of slain warriors hangs from a hook
An enormous owl has been carefully, if crudely, painted on the wall
Detailed, sprawling patterns have been scratched into the dirt, centered on a black slate slab
A ring is worn into the dirt around a fire pit, dotted with flecks of old, dried blood
A smashed clay bowl has strewn its contents near the door of a canvas tent
Strings of beads, scraps of cloth, and bone charms hang from prominent objects to mark territory borders
A nightmarish carving looms over a sleeping mat to scare away bad dreams
A cleared area with sturdy restraints anchored deep in the ground, stained with a large amount of old troll blood
A lightweight, camouflaged wooden hut, used by bugbears observing prey
A worn, flat stone with a clear view of the sky directly above

table.name: Gutter Gnoll Trinkets
intro: The following items might be carried by a gutter gnoll:
rows: A child's doll, torn and filthy
A burlap sack containing dozens of assorted buttons
A leather bucket containing a few belt buckles
A silk scarf, cleaner than its surroundings
A collection of miscellaneous receipts, promissory notes and invoices
An elegant, fashionable hat with the top knocked out
A bone needle and thread
A string of assorted cutlery worn as a necklace
A hessian sack of spoiled meat and old leather
An ale horn, tied to a belt with a shoelace

table.name: Gutter Gnoll Lair Details
intro: An area controlled by gutter gnolls might display the following:
rows: A buried cache of foul-smelling meat and a gnawed leather boot
An almost overwhelming musky stench emanates from a corner, a mixture of rotten meat, stagnant mud and raw sewage
Water constantly drips from the ceiling into a filthy, slowly spreading, brown pool
The floor is covered in a thick layer of soft furnishings at various levels of decay and destruction
Fist-sized clumps of matted hair dot the area
A collection of broken and discarded items hang crooked on the walls in a crude mockery of a picture gallery
Reeking piled linens form a nest so soiled that the imprint of a curled gnoll remains clearly defined
A stagnant pool, lumps of foulness collect in the stillness.
A barrel of beer bearing the stamp of a nearby tavern stands next to a few beer-soaked scraps of wood from another, some of which have been chewed
A territory marker cobbled together from a guard's polearm, sackcloth, browning bones, and a jagged-toothed skull

table.name: Plain Gnoll Trinkets
intro: The following items might be carried by a plains gnoll:
rows: A string of {@dice 2d6} body parts from various races, roll on this table for {@table Plain Gnoll Trinkets body parts|RotH|body parts}.
A scrap of plate armor bearing the crest of a noble house
A bone patterned with a red, clay paint
The dried and shrunken head of a hyena
A badly damaged ornamental knife made from a shard of volcanic glass
A wallet with embossed initials containing {@dice 1d4} gold pieces
Three mismatched leather boots of good quality, slightly chewed
A semicircle of skin ripped from a gnoll's ear
An iron spike fixed in the place of a missing tooth
A bundle of singed coarse fur, smelling of herbs and old blood

table.name: Plain Gnoll Trinkets body parts
intro: The following body parts might make up a plain gnoll trinket
rows: Fingers
Ears
Teeth
Scalps

table.name: Plain Gnoll Lair Details
intro: An area controlled by gutter gnolls might display the following:
rows: A ramshackle totem topped with a hyena skull daubed with symbols
Most of the grass here has been ripped up, and what little remains is trampled flat; the site of a recent kill
A looted and smashed wagon, reeking of hyena and smeared with musk
A leveled circle with inedible detritus scattered about where gnolls have spent an evening
An overturned cart on a rise with a good view of the road, acting as a windbreak for those watching for travelers
Quiet but constant chattering and occasional, sudden whoops from unseen hyenas
The tracks of a lone traveler lead one way before doubling back, and are rapidly overtaken by a throng of clawed footprints
Trees, or similar prominent land marks, are smeared with stinking white paste and marked by many strong, blunted claws
A circle of carefully smoothed grass around a large stone which is spattered with spots of dried blood
Grasses and twigs have been woven together into a camouflaged hunting blind

table.name: Rock Gnoll Trinkets
intro: The following items might be carried by a plains gnoll:
rows: A pouch of drow coins stamped with a spider
A broken spring-loaded trap
A branding iron
A ledger written in elven script with rough pictograms and tally marks
A delicate chain strung with several rings
{@dice 10d6} feet of knotted, spliced, repurposed rope
A leather belt attached to a length of chain
A set of mismatched keys and one tuning fork
A skin full of heady, mixed spirits
A ritual bloodletting knife

table.name: Rock Gnoll Lair Details
intro: An area controlled by gutter gnolls might display the following:
rows: A corral of wooden stakes forming a slave pen
A collection of empty crates and carts set up to resemble a meeting of traders not far from the road
A pile of metal trap components with several sets of footprints leading to and from
Ropes of varying lengths and qualities hung on iron hooks in an unorganized fashion
A cage large enough to hold three humanoids, suspended over a deep chasm by a great length of coiled rope and chain
The rough walls have collected a large amount of snagged, striped fur
The rank, sharp musk of gnoll and hyena cuts through all other smells, trapped by air currents and fermenting in this area
The acoustics of this area's rock walls allow even the quietest whisper to be heard clearly
A trader's wagon, brightly proclaiming their wares, is overturned and built upon to form a cell
A large pile of boots and shoes of various sizes and states of wear
